title: 8 Essential Figma Tips Empower Designers to Build Scalable Branded Templates in Buzz

paragraphs.content: Figma's official blog details eight key tips for designers creating branded templates in Figma Buzz, a beta tool for generating on-brand assets like social posts and ads. These guidelines emphasize starting in Figma Design frames, using auto layout for responsive flexibility, and separating text layers with descriptive names like “Event Title” for Bulk Create compatibility. The approach locks brand elements such as logos while allowing edits to content like CTAs and images, ensuring consistency across marketing campaigns.

sections.title: Mastering Auto Layout and Layer Strategies for Flexible Templates

paragraphs.content: Designers should use auto layout as the backbone for responsive designs that adapt to varying content like long headlines without breaking spacing. Descriptive layer names, such as “CTA Button Text” or example formats like “Date of Event (e.g. July 10, 2025),” help users map CSV data accurately in Bulk Create. Testing with realistic content ensures templates handle diverse inputs effectively.

sections.title: Leveraging Variants and Publishing for Team Empowerment

paragraphs.content: Component variants consolidate options like horizontal/vertical logos or color styles into one set, letting users swap via dropdowns or toggles without full edits. Copying frames from Figma Design to Buzz preserves properties for dynamic layouts, colors, and sizes. This connects templates to design systems, simplifying browsing in the template picker.
